channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Jumper - FATALITY; INC#0891; 01:53PM; Sb 405 Fy; MAP: https://bit.ly/3S956cb; Westchester; At 1:29pm LAFD responded to reports of a person who jumped off the 105FY overpass to the 405FY. Firefighters located one patient (age/gender unknown) determined deceased on scene. Any questions, to include duration and impact to freeway traffic, are directed to CHP Log# 1345 No further details.; FS 95; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC4 E205 E5 E51 E95 EM9 RA51 T5 T95; CH7; 14; Margaret Stewart

FIRE OUT Structure Fire; INC#0396; 08:37AM; 9901 N Lurline Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/44k9LP4; Chatsworth; Firefighters located a fire out (food on the stove) and heavy smoke in one unit on the 2nd floor. One female patient (age unknown) is being evaluated for possible smoke inhalation and transportation to the hospital. Fire doors activated and contained the smoke to one section of hallway near the fire unit. Firefighters are working to ventilate and clear the remainder of the smoke. No evacuation required. No further details.; FS 107; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC14 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E104 E107 E273 E28 E287 E288 E293 E296 E70 E89 EM15 HR3 RA107 RA889 RA89 T73 T87 T88 T93 T96 UR88 UR89; CH9; 17 18; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0396; 08:21AM; 9901 N Lurline Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/44k9LP4; Chatsworth; Large, three story garden style apartment building with fire in one unit on the 2nd floor. Two additional task forces requested. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 107; Batt 15; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 E107 E287 E296 E70 RA107 T87 T96; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1700; 11:29PM; 112 W 5th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vtI6Mb; Downtown; KNOCKDOWN: 42 firefighters located and extinguished fire in one unit on the 14th floor in 24 minutes. The fire was held to the unit of origin with no injuries reported. Firefighters are investigating the extent of any water removal required / water damage to units below. No further details.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 E203 E209 E210 E211 E3 E4 E9 EM1 RA209 SQ21 T10 T11 T3 T9; CH9; 14; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#1700; 11:05PM; 112 W 5th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3vtI6Mb; Downtown; Firefighters located fire in one unit (held in check by fire sprinklers) on the 14th floor of a high rise building. One additional task force requested. Firefighters are in the offensive mode.; FS 9; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 E203 E209 E210 E211 E3 E4 E9 EM1 RA209 SQ21 T10 T11 T3 T9; CH9; 14; Margaret Stewart

KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#0732; 12:32PM; 340 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/449r99c; Koreatown; KNOCKDOWN: 28 firefighters held the blaze to the unit of origin and extinguished it in 11 minutes with no injuries reported. The adjacent units were defended from damage. Cause and $ loss TBD. No further details.; FS 29; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 E13 E229 E29 E52 E6 RA35 RA61 T29; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Structure Fire; INC#0732; 12:21PM; 340 S Normandie Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/449r99c; Koreatown; Three story modern, garden style, apartment building with fire showing in one unit on the top floor. Firefighters are in the offensive mode. ; FS 29; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC11 E13 E229 E29 E52 RA61 T29; CH9; 13; Margaret Stewart

Auto vs Pedestrian; INC#0405; 07:55AM; 6275 W Colgate Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/40IXDUt; #MidWilshire; A vehicle struck two pedestrians (approx 6-year-old female & 35-year-old female) and then collided with a structure (two-story apartment). The adult female was sadly found to be deceased on scene. The young girl was transported in critical condition. The driver (approx 30-year-old male) was transported in fair condition. No one was trapped. Unknown extent of damage to the structure.; FS 61; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC18 E261 E41 E61 E68 EM18 HR3 RA27 RA41 RA52 T61; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Chemical Investigation; INC#1411; 05:39AM; 2800 S Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/41XrHN9; #RanchoPark; PIO Captain Erik Scott will assist news media on scene with an ETA of 6:30am. MEDIA: Stage to the north of the incident at 2600 S Sepulveda Blvd x Richland.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 DP1 DT1 E59 E95 JT2 JT3 JT4 PI1 SQ95; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange

Update Chemical Investigation; INC#1411; 10:30PM; 2800 S Sepulveda Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/41XrHN9; #RanchoPark; Firefighters arrived to find oil coming out of the ground at a rate of approximately 3-5 gallons per minute. They urgently created dams using shovels and nearby dirt to contain the leaking oil and protect the storm drains. An estimated total of approximately 1,000 gallons made its way out of the ground. The flow has been stopped and only about 20-40 gallons escaped into the storm drain before firefighters contained the rest in the immediate area. Clean Harbors ordered a vacuum truck, Street Services delivered sand, and LAFD Heavy Equipment will respond to position the sand to provide additional material to protect the drains and the environment. Multiple oil pipes run through the area and agencies are working together to determine which line was compromised. Watershed, LA County Health Hazmat, and Clean Harbors will clean up, along with the parties on site. No injury. No further hazard. Sepulveda is shut down in both directions for an unknown duration.; FS 59; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 5; BC9 DP1 DT1 E59 E95 JT2 JT3 JT4 PI1 SQ95; CH7; 13; Nicholas Prange
